comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
That bridge looks narrow,   it is probably the one with the big ugly truss,  although it is not very visible from this direction.
There seem to be quite a lot of houses on the other side.
There are two rows of recently planted trees in the park.
I will guess,  1939.

comment.author: 83990021@N04
comment._content: I tend to agree with mich . It appears to be the first bridge opened in 1924 and there appear to be no tram lines across the bridge so it must be after Sept 1939 The bridge was completed and officially opened on 23 December 1924 Ref: Local Studies Service Mosman Library Finally all public Manly tram services were ended on the night of the 30th September 1939 Ref: Brief Background History of Tramways in Manly Brief Background .. www.manlymania.net/Tramway/...
